title: Clean up some workarounds after upgrading minimum kernel version

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

body:
> Besides `O_CLOEXEC`, which other things would we be able to clean up?

Good question! There are 6 workarounds in `libstd` for older Linux versions (that I could find).
Increasing the minimum version to 2.6.32 (aka 3rd Kernel LTS, aka RHEL 6) would fix 5 of them.
Code links are inline:

- [ ] [`File::open_c`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/8b94e9e9188b65df38a5f1ae723617dc2dfb3155/src/libstd/sys/unix/fs.rs#L469-L505) uses the `O_CLOEXEC` flag with [`open(2)`](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/open.2.html) (mentioned above, added in 2.6.23)
- [ ] [`FileDesc::duplicate`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/8b94e9e9188b65df38a5f1ae723617dc2dfb3155/src/libstd/sys/unix/fd.rs#L230-L275) uses `F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC` with [`fcntl(2)`](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/fcntl.2.html) (added in 2.6.24, there is also the mention of a bug occuring on "some linux kernel at some point")
- [ ] [`pipe::anon_pipe`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/8b94e9e9188b65df38a5f1ae723617dc2dfb3155/src/libstd/sys/unix/pipe.rs#L21-L49) uses [`pipe2(2)`](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/pipe2.2.html) to atomically set the `O_CLOEXEC` flag on the pipe fds (added in 2.6.27)
- [ ] [`Socket::new_raw`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/8b94e9e9188b65df38a5f1ae723617dc2dfb3155/src/libstd/sys/unix/net.rs#L75-L86) uses `SOCK_CLOEXEC` with [`socket(2)`](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/socket.2.html) (added in 2.6.27)
- [ ] [`Socket::accept`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/8b94e9e9188b65df38a5f1ae723617dc2dfb3155/src/libstd/sys/unix/net.rs#L194-L215) uses [`accept4(2)`](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/accept4.2.html) to permit use of `SOCK_CLOEXEC` (added in 2.6.28)
- ~[`fs::copy`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/8b94e9e9188b65df38a5f1ae723617dc2dfb3155/src/libstd/sys/unix/fs.rs#L877-L955) uses [`copy_file_range(2)`](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/copy_file_range.2.html) (added in 4.5, not fixed by this proposal)~

As you can see, the workarounds fixed by this proposal all have a similar flavor.

_Originally posted by @josephlr in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62516#issuecomment-515869417_
